Articles.Content:
A simple to fly single seat SSTO.  For those days when you want to go to orbit just to enjoy views rather than because you have to.

 

 

https://kerbalx.com/Scarecrow88/Javelin-SSTO

I tried something similar when I first started trying SSTOs.  I dunno why, but I just can't build anything around the rapier.  I've had better luck using two sets of engines.

I like how it looks.  How's the dV after achieving orbit?  Enough to rendezvous and dock?
Very interesting design I might just have to try this one out.

5 hours ago, Geonovast said:

I tried something similar when I first started trying SSTOs.  I dunno why, but I just can't build anything around the rapier.  I've had better luck using two sets of engines.

I like how it looks.  How's the dV after achieving orbit?  Enough to rendezvous and dock?

I've just built a version with a docking port and RCS thrusters but haven't had a chance to fly it yet.  Based on flying the original to a 75k orbit, it may have enough to reach something in a 100k orbit, but probably no higher.  I will add an update when I have tried the docking version.

 

ETA : I have now flown the docking version and was able to dock with a station at 100k orbit, undock and then rendezvous and dock with another station at 250k orbit.  There was still enough fuel for a de-orbit burn from 250k, and enough jet fuel after the de-orbit burn to choose a landing spot.  It should be noted that I didn't add any monoprop to this craft, relying solely on the 7.5 units held in the command pod.  If your docking skills aren't up to relying on such a small amount, the addition of the extra weight of a mono tank would obviously affect the flight parameters.

You can download the docking version from Dropbox - https://www.dropbox.com/s/hkvpch7rk3ol4sl/Javelin SSTO Docker.craft?dl=0

Edited December 11, 2017 by Scarecrow
